div.head: To the most worthy paire of most religious persons, Sir Alexander Saint-John, and his vertuous Lady.
div.p: THis Text and Sermon doth exhort to good workes. It is my riches, that even in my poore Parish there are some, who preach this exhortation better by their practice, than I enforce it by my preaching: of whom (be it spoken without either disparaging them, or flattering you) yee are the chiefe. This hath been long printed in my thought, and now my thought is printed: I account it a maine branch of my happy content, that I have two such chosen people, so zealous of good works, living under my ministery.
